reviews.review_msg: I took this as an elective and overall I wasn't too happy with my grade, cuz I thought I would've gotten a higher grade with the amount of work I put in; but I DID like the class - Sheri's a cool person. She knows her material well and is a veteran in the field. If you wanna learn, take classes with her! But don't expect an easy ride. You must try.

Overall a good prof (and very fair). She covered a lot in class, which was very helpful. Her exams were sometimes tricky, but she did give out a lot of hints for the exams. As long as you follow directions, listen to the lecture recordings, and review the "put a star beside this" questions you will pass.

iclicker and how she does NOT post lecture slides makes it so you have to go to class and stay the whole time. As long as you copy the lecture slides and STAR the slides she says, you should be fine. Make sure you use the book. Paper was marked a little bit harsh. Midterm and final were long, just make sure you know your stuff. Overall she's okay.

Prof is really helpful and approachable. Some of the theory stuff in this course is very dry; however your grade will reflect the effort that you put in. Make sure to attend class and participate in her clicker quizzes; they are relatively easy if you do the boundaries reading. Her exams are long but if you know your stuff, you will do great.

Sheri is very clear on what she expects you to know for the exams and term paper. If she says that something will be on the exam, it WILL be on there. As long as you pay attention in class and keep up with your readings you should be able to get a really good mark. Her exams are long but if you know your material you will find it a breeze!
i dont know if she is trying to make a point or what but she makes her exams wayy to hard for a intro class she needs to tone it down a little
Very good teacher enjoyed her class would love to take a class with her again she goes out of her way to make the class fun engaging and your mark a reflection of the work you put in
She's passionate with what she teaches. She cares if you show that you care. Very helpful and clear in directions pertaining to term-paper. Made my 1st semester as SFU better :)
She's a really good prof. Her midterms are really fair and she gives you warning in advance for what's going to be on it. I-clicker questions are awesome.

She was nice. However, like 90% of university professors, she had a very left wing bias with her teachings. It wasnt a political course, but she managed to squeeze in her opinions anyway. Other than that, she was easy to get help from, she provided a lot of information (take good notes). Tough Marker though
Very helpful, takes interest in helping students

Lectures are really long & there's alot of info. Bring a laptop to type notes. Put a star on the sections she tells you..because they WILL appear on the exams. Exams are easy. I only read one chapter of the textbook...and didn't really finish the final exam because it was long and still got a decent grade. Nice prof easy course but lots to remember

This prof is NOT recommended to anyone. I have to admit I walked into the class thinking it would be a easy. But ultimately FAIL! She doesn't post notes, goes by the notes so fast, tests are extremely hard and scoring system is wack! BUT Sheri as a person, is a very nice individual office hours are helpful, I just think she shouldnt teach 100coures

shes a good prof but takes Academic dishonesty way too sereiously... she scared the crap outa me with all that talk bout failing the course and gettin kiked out of university for missing a citation... overall she cool tho.. really reasonable bout deadlines too.... pay attention to the book tho... she makes questions on some of the small things

Very boring lectures. Make class seem harder than it actually is. Midterm and final are fair but the MC is hard. You actually need to work hard to get a good grade. Don't let the "breath" fool you. She is extremelly helpful and gives you a lot of hints on what will be on the exam. She really makes it her goal to have her students do well!
She is super hot and so smart! The best instructor I have ever had!

Interesting class for the most part. Prof uploads partial lecture notes on WebCT so you have to go to class to get the notes. Participation marks given for answering iClicker questions in class-- another reason to attend. Exams are a little tricky but not unmanageable if you know your stuff. Really nice prof and always willing to help!
forgot to mention that have 101 & 104 with her in the same semester. Even better cos the content overlaps!
Great teacher with humor, but is a tough marker.
Great prof! Fun to listen too and she has a good sense of humour in her lectures.  Whcih helps keep the interest. Going to miss this class!
Raegan is great. She makes the subject interesting and she easily engages the class. Will definitely take another class with Raegan if possible; her study guide is the key to success!

Excellent prof. Very knowledgable and always available for help when needed. Gives you a review page of what will be on the exam one week before it, which makes her exams a lot easier. I would highly recommend her course to anybody
real good prof. but u have to go to class or youll be screwed. really chill and replys to emails super fast. if you study, u'll do well.

Interesting prof, but mt and final are pretty hard. She likes to pick esoteric things and asks for definitions of them. Would be better if exams were MC, short answer, essay only. Go to class, her exams are note based less text based.
really hard marker on essay.
She's great! Easy marker of essays. I would definitely take her again.  Easy A. :)
No Comments
Just show up and copy the lecture notes. That's all you need for the tests. Participating and showing up to tutorials is a significant portion of the mark, do not skip these.

Barry is one of the nicest and funniest profs you'll ever meet at SFU. He's a fair marker and also goes over the exam itself before he gives it the next lecture. Focus on the slides he tells you to focus on because the exam is mainly focussed on that but don't forget the other parts. Definitely recommend taking this course. Wish he taught more.

Has a clear teaching style and a good dry sense of humor that brightens up the lectures a bit. Exams were fair so long as you take notes during lectures, since he mentions specific things that will be on the exam. Definitely recommend the online course, it's one of the more straightforward online ones I've taken

BEST PROFESSOR EVER. CRIM 101 WILL FOREVER BE MY FAVOURITE CLASS. I can't even stress how easy this class is. Just memorize all the notes absolutely no need to do the readings. Start studying for the midterm and final 1 week in advance memorize 1 chapter's notes per day and you will get an A I promise you. Make sure you memorize ALL the notes.

He's a really good prof, but he doesn't post his slides so students have to attend the class. Tut attendance and participation are really important. Before each exam, he does a review of important topics, and if you memorize that review you can get 100%. What you get on your paper depends on your TA (hope yall get a nice TA :D)

Barry is a GREAT prof. No tricks on exams or papers and a VERY generous marker. You have to come to lectures and tutorials to achieve your grade but class is not difficult. The TA's were really approachable. 10/10 recommend!!

The only thing you really need the textbook for is for your term paper otherwise everything you learn in the textbook is covered in lecture. Pretty much everything you need to know for the midterm and final is in the notes, so as long as you copy down the slides you are good to go. He doesn't post the slides online, but he gives you note outlines.

Funny guy who tried to make the more boring material funny. Tests were super straightforward and based on memorization. He highlighted all important material for us in the lecture before midterm & final. Textbook needed as not everything covered in class was in enough detail. Notes posted online are only outlines, must attend lecture for full notes

Pretty funny guy. Makes the 2hour lecture more bearable. Exams were SUPER easy and straightforward. If it wasnt for my paper that pulled my grade down dramatically, I wouldve received a solid 98% in the class. Definitely recommend

Interesting professor. He tries to put humor into the lectures to make it less boring and difficult. His lecture notes are heavy so beware of that. 20% for participation for tutorial seems peculiar. He does not upload lecture notes. To fairly put, nice course but wouldn't want to take it again.

He goes over basically everything you need to know in lecture, be prepared to take notes though. Doesn't post anything online so you gotta show up unless you wanna read the textbook. He gives plenty of time to write everything down and does review of everything you need to know for the midterm or final the lecture before.
Tests are based on lecture and tutorial slides, he's funny and interesting (even thought he mostly just reads off his slides).

I enjoyed this class so far the mid term was really easy if you pay attention in tutorial and lectures. A large part of your grade is participation which can easily boost your mark. The lectures are clear and he gives time to take all the notes needed. You do have to attend but it isn't painful to sit through.

The class is fairly easy and boring but Barry throws in enough jokes to make it more enjoyable, he gives you the slides to study for both the midterm and the final so lectures are mandatory but the textbook isn't.

A LOT of typing/writing so be prepared in lectures. Other than that, it's pretty boring but he does try to throw in a joke here and there which makes it slightly better. The week before the midterm/exam, he will do a review session and everything he says will be examined, so just studying what he tells you to is enough for getting a decent mark

NEVER TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM!! Honestly is so rude, won't answer your questions, will literally send you an email accusing you of cheating if you ask for help. Crim 101and 104 are literally decently easy classes if you stay on top of your readings, but Barry makes it unenjoyable, and his online tutorials are boring.

The class is quite boring and so are his tutorials. If you pay attention in class and the tutorials you will be ok. If you want higher then a C+ I suggest you read the textbook, as almost all of the multiple choice questions of my final were about various things in the textbook. Also, you have to be able name & explain theories he talks about.

First midterm wasn't overwhelming because I studied too much material that was not being tested on. Tip to anyone who takes crim 101 is to note down EVERYTHING he says and shows during the review sessions cuz it WILL be on the final. He directly told me that when I was going over my midterm which I did poorly on. I ended up with an A on the final.

Barry is a great prof and it is clear he has taught this course many times before. Lectures are very dense so get ready to write, but he does keep it entertaining with lots of jokes. Online tutorials are easy marks and the term paper was not difficult. Midterm and final were very fair as he tells you exactly what will be on it. Would recommend.

pretty nice dude makes lectures interesting by injecting some humour. the online tutorials are very dry and pretty much say the same thing as the lectures but they're easy marks. his lectures are very information dense so get ready to write/type a lot. tests and papers weren't super difficult but make sure you start studying in advance.

Easy A if you show up to class and take lecture notes. Tons of theories to memorize but he tells you exactly what will be tested on the midterm and final so it shouldn't be too bad. Term papers are marked quite hard though and it is worth 20%. Overall, I really enjoy having this class as an elective.

Make sure you show up to lectures, because often his slides contain blanks that are not posted online which means lectures are mandatory if you want to get the notes. He's good at explaining the concepts, but more often than not he's just reading off the lecture notes that are already filled in. TA's are rude.

this class was really easy, he posts half the notes online so you have to come to class for the other half, you don't need the textbook because the class right before the exam he'll tell you exactly which slides you need to study, exams are easy if you study, online tutorial is also easy, the term paper was kinda hard tho

Great prof, makes sure to give students enough time for people to take notes during lectures. He knows his stuff and you can tell he has taught this class before. However I did not like that he did not give the grading criteria for the essay. Makes it hard to know where you could improve and/or if you were graded fairly.

Barry Cartwright my favourite prof. His lectures are very detailed and informative, he has a clear voice and doesn't stray off topic. He gives outlines for the midterm and final. The textbook isn't really needed, but it's nice to have to understand things better. He is extremely approachable, I suggest going to him for help with the paper.
very funny, easy to study for
Really tough grader...
Keep up with reading the textbook and taking the online quizzes.  Lots of material covered but he gives midterm and final exam reviews that really help narrow it down

he is a hilarious man! Even though his class is like 400 people, but his humour makes it a bit more bearable. His midterm is not too hard, as long as you study his lecture notes, you'll be ok. Term paper is graded a bit harder. His online tutorials are easy marks too!

Basically the lecture before the class he'll tell you which subtopics from the notes taken from him will be on the test. Easy A IF you study!!! I wished I tried harder, would've been a great GPA booster. No textbooks needed for test, but needed for the term paper.

Dr. Cartwright is fairly knowledgable. The textbook is mandatory as are the lecture slides. The tutorials are extremely easy as is the actual content in the course. The term paper was straight forward and the marking was fair.  There were no surprises on the midterm and final.  He is very engaging in lecture.  Easy course if you put in the time.

Most hilarious professor ever, easily makes jokes about everything which keeps his lectures interesting. Always offers his own time for office hours if help is needed, the responsibility to ask for help is on you though. Tough grader for papers but midterms and finals are easy enough if you attend class and do the tutorials.

He is a really fun and outgoing guy. The course itself requires a lot of memorization. He tells you everything that will be on the midterm and finals. Best way to study the for test is off the powerpoints he shows in class.

Barry is an excellent prof and like others have said, the course is set up for you to succeed. Exams are extremely fair  and easy if you thoroughly study the slides mentioned in the review. Tutorial review is important  and the textbook is only necessary for the term paper as lecture notes are very detailed. He's the best professor I've had yet!
Lectures are entertaining as he's hilarious but he's a very tough marker when it comes to tests. For that reason I wouldn't take this class with him. Lectures are clear

Overall a very good prof. Knowledgeable, funny. Specifies what is going to be on tests. Online tutorials are very good reinforcement for what you learn in class. The only bad quality is that his powerpoint slides are like wall text. If you can get past that  you're gold.

Very enthusiastic and knowledgable about the course material. Online tutorials had some tricky quiz questions so pay attention to the details. The course is set up for you to succeed. Show up, write down the notes, memorize and you should do well in the class.

Lectures are long and you'll be taking lots of notes. Had weekly online tutorials which were pretty easy. The midterm and final exam were very fair. There are some textbook questions on the exams but I got away without reading it and aced both tests. Overall, it's a pretty easy course but you obviously have to put effort in and study to get an A.
His voice can put anyone to sleep.

Took this class online. Agree with person below, not helpful at all, does come off as rude and the TA has the same attitude.  If you don't like or care to ask questions, then Barry is a great lecturer and he is very clear in his slides and tutorials.  You get a 0 if you click 1 wrong thing in the online tutorials. Avoid

Great in the sense that he tells you EXACTLY what he is looking for and expecting. But absolutely no help in questions and no sympathy given. Afraid to ask questions during the lecture or even emailing him because it is true that he will belittle you whether it's in front of the whole lecture or through email. Comes off rude sometimes.

Lecture are not interesting with lots of note-taking.  Online tutorials are even worse, but they are easy marks to redeem yourself. Be prepared for EVERYTHING for the exams. Average for the midterm was 66% and average for the final was 59%.

I took the online class and to be honest I learned absoluty nothing. The whole class is based on essays. And they dont really give you an opportunity to prove what youve learned. Not recommended at all!

He makes criminology really interesting because he tells a lot of jokes throughout his lectures and keeps people listening.  The only problem is that since his classes are so large you can sometimes just feel like part of a crowd.   Also, he provides lecture outlines beforehand but you have to fill most of it out.
He wasn't helpful. Never responded to my emails and was very belittling when I talked to him one of one. But his class is super easy. The only time you really the book is to write the paper

BEST Prof ever! Extremely approachable, organized and knows his stuff. Exams are very straight forward, you study and get an A. I would take all the classes he offers.   He puts in a lot of effort to make the class a good experience.

Barry is a great prof! His exams were very fair because he specifically tells you which slides to study from. Although his lectures are boring, they are mandatory to go to as there are iclicker quizzes at the end of every lecture. The term paper was marked a bit harshly but that was only cause the TA's marked them. Overall, I'd recommend him!

Barry is the ideal prof, he's funny and intelligent. He encourages students to visit him during office hours because he really does want you to do well. Midterm, term paper and final are all fair and straight forward. There are no surprises. Excellent professor, would recommend him to anyone.
soooooooooo great
Amazing prof, very entertaining. Course content is quite boring and useless but his exams are mostly based off of lecture slides. Exams are fair and easy.
It was my favourite class yoooo. Rowdyyyy and heccctic broooo

Easy. Straight memorization but the course material is absolutely useless and hard to retain. Lectures are long and boring but exams are fair/easy. Paper was simple. Take it as a GPA booster. Never opened my textbook once.

Took this class as an elective and it wasn't too bad. He's a great prof, very entertaining and knows his stuff. Quizzes & tests are super fair. The essay was alright, marked a bit hard in my opinion - focused too much on format. Take it as an elective!

Barry is the gold-standard for awesomeness. His exams are very fair and based almost entirely on lecture slides and Boundaries. He prepares students very well for exams, and his essays are not insanely hard. A funny prof who makes material easy to learn. Easily the best prof I've ever had. Looking forward to taking another course with him.
Funny and helpful, i actually looked forward to his lectures. Eaasy peasy course, i highly recommend it.

His lectures are really interesting!Barry is a great prof. He is willing to help you if you go to his office hours. One downside in his course is be ready for iclicker quizzes. He gives an iclicker quiz every single class. The quiz is based on the tutorial readings
HILARIOUS PROF!! makes a lot of jokes. class is relatively easy, i'd definitely recommend it as its quite interesting. take this class with this prof!

The required text was totally irrelevant.I bought one because it was required, it turned out that we don't use it at all.I went to sell it back but they said that a new edition is coming out and that they don't buy back this edition anymore.What a total rip off.If you're taking this course DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK because you will not use it at all.
Great Guy! No point in reading the textbook as his tests are based on his lectures. Funny guy and provides great (but a lot of) notes. He helps students succeed.
He taught me how to take care of my iclicker.. His tests weren't too bad. All the stuff is straight from the notes. Lectures were entertaining except for the 3 hrs of note taking! Good prof overall!

Great teacher. Straight forward tells you exactly whats going to be on the midterm/final plus its all straight from his notes. Don't need the main text book but boundaries is mandatory as you get quizzed on it every tutorial. Tries to make the course interesting by adding in jokes. Highly recommended for GPA booster

Great Prof! Tries to make class interesting! You need the tutorial book for iClicker tests and also your project. Attendance is essential! You need the notes which he only gives you half of the notes online and in class he fills them in! exams based on notes! Great teacher and great course!

Gives his students all the necessary tools to do well in this class. Do not buy the text book because you will not use it. Just make sure you attend class and take down the notes. All you need to know for the mideterm/final exam comes from the class notes. Make sure you remember dates, names and stas for the exams. Overall, great prof!

Exams are MC/TF/Short-answer/paragraph. Need to memorize names, dates etc to get a good mark on exams. iClicker quizzes are straight-forward - just read the book and memorize the names/dates. Bring a laptop with you, unless you like writing notes non-stop for 3 hours since they are mandatory for passing.

WOW looks like he has devoted his life to making his courses fun, interesting,& easy gpAboosters! Made me laugh throughout lecture & tutorials, and even when I got my marks back (always got more than expected). To get an A, I just studied review slides day before the exams, wrote term paper in less than 2 days, and did the reading before tutorial.

Term papers are marked easily and Barry will actually edit it for you if you go to his office hours. Exams are easy if you study the lecture notes (he tells you what slides to memorize). Very detail-oriented, but not hard to memorize. Only problem was iClicker quizzes. Some questions asked were useless/irrelevant. But loved the class. Barry rocks!
Very interesting lectures. He is so funny and he jokes around a lot. But his exams are BRUTAL. THey cover SO MUCH material ...

BC is very nice and sweet old guy, replies to emails/Qs respectfully. His tests are REALLY hard on definitions and in lecture you spend more time finishing his notes (u can print half the sentence) then paying attention. He focuses a lot on names and info that doesn't seem important. But he gives lots of chances to get free participation type marks
Fair tests and lectures are interesting.

Barry, to be honest, is an useless professor. You learn nothing from his class; midterms and finals were ALL based on his lecture notes (he even tells you which section is going to be tested on and which aren't). If you're not a crim major student, then by all means, take courses with him. If you're a crim major student, find another teacher.

This class was one of my favorites at SFU! You need to go to class for notes - I would say bring a laptop instead of printing out the outlines. Midterm Review is helpful and the exam is right from the notes. One thing I didn't like were the debates that we had to do - reading them were long and boring and not enjoyable at all. Good class though!

good prof.. gives half of the notes, you have to fill in the rest. not a bad class. easy midterm. he shows you the slides that will be on the midterm when he does a review. look over your notes and use the text for extra understanding - only read over stuff that relates to his notes.

Great lecturer, provides outline of lecture notes online for you to fill in during class. Low textbook usage, I didn't read past the first chapter. His TAs were ultra-helpful and fun. One complaint - movies in class are totally unrelated to material!

AWESOME PROF! such an easy class! he pretty much gives you all his lecture notes you just had to finish the sentence and thats about it. I did my term paper the day before it was due and got an A+. I highly recommend this class and prof! the exams are SO easy, i finished in like 30 mins and he is pretty funny too

I LOVE this prof! best prof! he is very funny and easy, but! have to memorize the stats mentioned in lecture!! make sure u attend lecture be4 his exams, he'll do a review showing all the slides that wud be tested on exams! just memorize them!
Dope prof. Tells jokes, really easy, exams fair, interesting lectures although a lot of notetaking

Prepare to learn nothing in class, there are way too many notes to write down while he talks in the background.  Why can't he provide them (they are powerpoint)?!  Other than that, he is a nice guy and knows his stuff.  Fair/easy exams, you DO NOT need the textbook (only the tutorial book).  Just take notes from his notes and you'll do great.

he actually reminds me of a hobbit...maybe even Bilbo Baggins...haha..class is easy if you listen in lecture and study his notes THROUGHLY!!(HINT HINT)..didnt need the textbook as what is tested are all given in his notes..lectures are a bit slow and quite a bit of notetaking as only the lecture outlines are given..overall a potential GPA booster
Very easy course, pretty much everything he said on the review will be on the exam. Easy prof, recommended =)
Very good professor, knows what he is doing, is very entertaining and is willing to and wants to help.  I recommend taking any criminology class with B. Cartwright.

LOVE this prof, lectures are interesting and LOVE LOVE LOVE his notes! i didnt even buy the textbook, i went thru the course all from his notes! Just go to class and LISTEN to him! i got 10% in my midterm (my fault, i didnt bother attending class or rememebering the date of the midterm)... and i got a B+ at the end!! =D just remb to read his notes!
WHAT IS EVERYONE SAYING? THIS PROF IS SO HARD...HIS EXAMS ARE DIFFICULT, HIS LECTURES ANNOYING, AND HE ALWAYS THINKS HE IS RIGHT...I DONT KNOW EVERY RULE IN LAW OK BARRY?

Not a huge fan of his, usually had troubles staying awake in the class, but I think that was more of an issue with the room's temperature and my schedule than him.  It was a good experience, I don't think I'll take another crim class though.
Great professor, really funny, keeps the lectures interesting, and makes it very clear what he will be testing, no surprises. Learnt a lot this semester.

DEFINITELY take this class wtih barry, EASY midterm EASY final (as long as you study) - realizes that we have a life outside of class so for the review day he narrows all of his slides down to just the ones that are covered on the tests - if its not on the review its not on the test.  Replies to emails quickly and is also a pretty entertaining guy

Barry is extremely helpful as he answers his e-mails quite quickly and is always available for help during office hours.  He prepares you in your future courses well with a short term paper, which he said once he is doing it for students' goods.  Exams are easy as long as you read his lecture notes.  Course reader is a must because he tests on it.
You have to do a class presentation in the tutorials.  I'm not good and do not like doing presentations.
don't need to do the readings from lecture, for the tutorial, do em, they'll bring u up about a letter grade on tests. this course is EASY

So far best prof in sfu. Hope the rest of the courses with him will be as good. in depth n updated notes makes textbook useless to read. Mt n final pretty easy if u know the stuff. Common sense but lots of terms to mem. overall awesome course and stress free.

Course was a breeze.  Everything that is testable is in the lectures.  Do not overlook the course reader though; some of it appears on the midterm and final.  Barry is a nice professor, but he rambles on sometimes in hopes for a few laughs.  His partial notes and lecture methods should be THE standard for every university course-- very helpful!
Very easy class ! All you have to do is go to the lectures and read the material once and you'll do well ... very easy exams!!

Very interesting lecs, but lots of writing in spite of printed powpt outlines. Lecs are mostly simple and clear, but sometimes confusing to study when ideas overlap each other all the time. However, there is a huge amount of material for the tests - with stats, authors, figures and even stuff from tutorial book. Its ok but not as easy as you think
This was a horrible prof!  He was condescending and actaully seemed like he wanted students to fail.  Class was easy though, I got an A
He tries really hard to make the material interesting, really nice guy.

She was a darling, but she just barely kept the reins on the class! She did try to make it as interesting as was possible and she chose good courseware material. If you don't study and take notes (GO TO THE LECTURES...FOR YOUR OWN GOOD) you can fail!
professor sears was so sweet and nice! i would definitely take another crim course or whtever course if she teaches it =)

She is a sweetheart, a little ditsy but sweet. Her tests are very fair. Basically, just go to class, take good notes and study them and you'll be more than fine. Jennifer Chapman is also an awesome TA.

Easy course, nice teacher. Camillia seems like a really kind person. Just show up to class, copy the notes and study from that and you're good. 2 hour classes are boring sometimes, but for easy marks it's definetly a course to take.
Shes really cute but she has no control over the class. Also shes way to quiet. Shes really nice though and really helpful. I think i would like her as a person but shes not the greatest teacher

She's very helpful and nice, athlough her lecture is a bit boring. Midterm was fair but my ta was very hard on it. Everything's clear and concise. Guys, focus on her lecture materials, that's my little suggestion, good luck.
SHES SUCH A SWEETHEART! id love to have her again!!
Are you people deaf and blind?
Shes soooooo nice!
Great teacher, VERY helpful! Yea she tends to be nervous but she's very nice. Midterm and final is the same style. Great exams! Average was 73% for the midterm
No Comments
Very straightforward teaching style

Camilla is a great prof who is very organized with her notes so you know exactly whats gona be on the exams..nothing out of the blue. I really like her teaching style, its very clear and concise! Her exams are fair, not too easy or too hard. Shes veryy nice and sweet! I would definietly take another course with her!!
The reason it's unoriginal is because she's nervous! Easily one of the most organized and easy to understand classes. Seems like a really nice person and very approachable.
boring, unoriginal, puts me to sleep most of the time, and teaches out of the textbook, which makes it questionable to attend lecture. She is nice and happy though.

Amazingly uninteresting. She seems an incredibly nice person, but is the most boring of my professors yet. She cannot hold my attention or the attention of anyone I know, and her high pitched voice almost drove me up the wall. However, she is willing to help.
Bryan was a great prof but we didn't have many assignments which resulted in the midterm and final exam being most of our grade. The exams were all multiple choice which made the course easier.

He always got off topic and his lectures were hard to follow because he talked about random things. He was really funny if you listen, but his lectures were not very helpful. However, the assignments were easy and the exams were all multiple choice and entirely based on the textbook. Not a bad class to take, but not one of my favourites.
A good class, and fairly easy but my only complaint was that it was a bit unorganized. It was easily accessible online if you had to miss for any reason.

Kinney was nice and funny. He was a bit unorganized and canceled a few classes however his class gave me the opportunity to have time for my other heavy courses. Attending tutorials were very helpful considering the lecture was sorta boring and useless. Grading is very pleasant knowing 40% is technically participation. It is an easy gpa booster.

Bryan is so boring that just about anyone could fall asleep during his lectures. He goes off topic a lot and it is impossible to follow his slides. The midterm and final are both online, multiple-choice, and open-book. He words the questions very weirdly so you gotta read the questions carefully. It's easy to do well in his class though.

Professor was kind, but I found that I was trying to teach myself the entire course because I was unable to follow/focus in his lessons. Course was disorganized with multiple cancelled lectures and tutorials.

Professor Kinney clearly cares about his students, but he is super disorganized. Don't expect him or the TA's to answer any emails. Lots of cancelled lectures/tutorials. Great online lectures, but in the classroom he is really hard to hear.

People were upset that he did mostly online rather than in person but I did not mind one bit. He goes on a lot of tangents but overall makes class not boring. Easy to get a good grade. Exams were online and covered LOTS of detail so keep up with notes.
Boring lectures. Grading is unfair. Participation is 20% + TA's grade hard.

Bryan is amazing! He is one of the only profs to realize we are in a pandemic. He is extremely caring and willing to move deadlines in order to make the lives of his students easier. Quizzes and the final were open book. My only complaint is that he can be a bit disorganized. Nevertheless, taking the course with Bryan is amazing.

Dr. Kinney is SUPER caring and understanding. He is one of the few profs that realize we are in a pandemic, so he is very understanding to all situations. Easy quizzes and final. Great prof, highly recommended.

I've heard such good things about CRIM101, but not with this prof. Though HILARIOUS, he doesn't seem very passionate about the subject. He makes you memorize the textbook from cover to cover (including graphs, that he never asked you to study in the first place??) and doesn't even construct his own power points or exams, so he gets lost a lot.

Distance Ed, course material is dry, but relatively easy. Lots of terms to memorize, thus final was hard with attention to details. TO to well: read study guide!!! know your terms, put effort into your essays. My TA was wonderful & very helpful. :)

WAY TOO BORING. Could not concentrate on lectures because he is so boring. He makes stupid "jokes" and nobody laughs or one person laughs which is even more embarrassing for him. Not a GPA booster if the prof is so boring that you can't pay attention in lectures.

Lectures can be boring, but Kinney is a good prof. Course material is not too hard, as long as you stick to you readings you will do well in the class. Too much emphasis on participation, about 18% of your final mark comes from your participation, otherwise, everythin else is fair.

Kinney is extremely nice, he gave me the answer to a question on the final. He is monotone and his jokes are hilarious, he talks about World of warcraft every lecture, and he tries to be G. Stick to the textbook to study for exams. He asks mostly general questions. some specifics. lectures arent mandatory but they are helpful.

Kinney was absolutely horrible.  You don't need to attend and if you do you better have your laptop.  Read your textbooks and study on your own bases.  Kinney gets so side tracked it's not even funny.  Plus, his jokes are horrible.

midterm and test was all based on book, just don't even attend lecture , just tutorials for the mark, ( he used some of the same questions from the midterm on the final) w/o going to lecture , ur gonna get the same mark overall, power point are all based on the textbook,

I got an A- in the course. All thats required is that you study the definitions in the margins of each chapter and know some info about important people he mentions in lecture. Tests are all MC, and paper is only 750-1000 words (so its pretty short). Overall, workload isn't bad.
Bryan was a great prof! Totally nice guy, lectures are a little dry but its hard to make intro to crim interesting. I would take another class with him.
I like this prof, he gets off topic easy in lecture, but he's funny.

i dont noe what to say about this guy.....dont even attend the lectures just buy the textbook and pretty much remeber like 1000 names and terms for the exams......his paper was pointless......i recomend you to not take this class with him only if your good at teaching yourself the course cuz he doesnt teach your jack!!
the prof is actually pretty good its just how he speaks during the lectures is for mono tone and its gets boring and sleepy. mid term and exams werent that bad.
forget lectures, just attend tutorials. online notes r usually useless. his voice is droning and he gets way off topic. at least exams r easy and the paper is alright

here's the deal w/ this class... you pay to take 2 exams and write a paper... DO NOT go to tutorials or lectures or even bother downloading notes.. COMPLETELY POINTLESS.If you read the book.. and just do key terms and names.. thats IT. seriously... easy tests but useless professor. VERY boring content. only take this course if you need to!

not a bad class. just memorize key terms and ppl in text and u'll be fine cuz tests are all MC. the paper was alrite and its only worth 9%. overall lectures were pretty useless, just read the text . it was a pretty okay class.

Kinney is a nice guy and willing to help students if they ask. His exams are all mc and based mostly on definitions presented in the text. Class avg. for the midterm was 75. His notes are helpful in that they show you which concepts and people to focus on, but they don't need to be memorized. Just to warn you this course is memory intensive.
Lectures are EXTREMELY boring so skip it.  Just download all the notes off Webct. Midterm and final was based 99% from the textbook so actually don't even bother studying lecture notes.

This was actually a good class. I think a lot of people didn't like it because it was a little boring, but come on! Its a intro class - what do you expect people!! I found the lectures helped me out and he made them humorous, which was better than just reciting the stuff... so I thought he was a great prof.
Very boring teacher. Do not need to go to lectures just read the book.
No Comments
Easy exams, nice guy, lectures are so freakin boring
No Comments

easy. his midterm and final is MC. one essay with a broad topic. everything u need to know is in the textbook so u dont really need to go to lectures since u'll most likely be there to nap. the only thing they're good for is his sarcastic jokes.
Of a class of 300+, maybe 70 show up to the lecture and half fall asleep. He's a super nice guy, but he gets off topic quite a bit.
ramble ramble ramble. this guy makes me want to shot myself. he takes 30 mins to get to a simple point that could've been made in 1.

i think half the time i didnt even need to go to lecture, exams are right from the book!
 he's a really nice guy and REALLY TRIES TO HELP STUDENTS(tried to clarify a confusing topic from lecture in webCT discussion)
 however...HIS VOICE!...2 hours in a comfy images theatre seat listening to monotony...good thing i always bring coffee!
Pretty useless course.  Weird exams, and very questionable answers.  Some of his answers contradict the text book. Final was pretty tough imo.
very good prof =) willing to help students, and easy to talk to, course is not too hard.
hv a coffee or smoke or do whatever thing 2 wake u up b4 lecture, otherwise, u'll definitely fall asleep. exams r all MC, but tricky bcoz he tests every concept. ALL he tests on is from the textbook.
The lectures are SO boring, you'll never want to go. But he can be funny and the course load and tests are fair and pretty easy.

This professor is fairly easy and rather funny. However, talking in monotone all the time isn't exactly helpful against the desire to sleep in class. If only he can have a bit more variety with his voice, the class wouldn't seem so boring.

don't listen to the people below.  the class is easy in the sense that everyone can get a B.  If you want to get an A-(85%), study your ass off.  If you want to get an A (90%), you better hope he scales it.  I'll be surprised if more than one person sits at over 90% by the end of the course.
I played hang man all lecture and still got a decent mark. Really boring, no useful information in lectures.

Narcoleptics and those not addicted to caffeine will fall asleep before he makes his fairly humourous jokes in class to wake everyone up periodically. Cool guy in person despite his early mid-life crisis. Most realize he's a good lecturer when they can stay awake.

he had way too many slides and as long as you didnt really evan need to read one of the books so long as you went to tutorials and know how to do a multiple choice test your set i agree that yes he is nice and friendly but slides and stats are not my favorite thing i must say
Bryan is a good prof... he's funny as well... around every 3-4 minutes, he'll make a joke that makes the entire class laugh.

The class has some interesting perks, but they are usually found in the book. The prof. seems nice, and has a good sense of humor, but 2 hours of stats and graphs is just too much for me. All of his notes are from powerpoint presentations which can just be printed off at home.

Easy credit, although boring lectures.  Has difficulty controlling a lecture full of first year gremlins who are poking each other and chattin' it up.  Still, he's a good guy with a great sense of humour.  Upper division classes probably a lot better.
A great guy but the material he had to teach was boring.  Always good for a laugh, he has a great sense of humour!!

It seemed like a really fun class.  He would crack a few good jokes every lecture but the class is a bore and is empty at the end of the semester.  He only reiterates what is on the notes.  Go home and print it out.  Midterm is relatively easy~  Good intro to crim tho~
wow has no control over the class...lecture is kinda a waste of time, however brian is a nice guy

He seems like he would be an interesting guy outside of class but his lectures are really boring. Too many stats and charts for my liking. The class is pretty easy though as long as you do your readings.

A really nice, funny easygoing guy. His lectures pretty much suck, just speaks in a monotonous voice and clicks through powerpoint slides, but as a person he seems really nice and cracks some good jokes now and then
crappiest teaching organization ever. hard(and lots) to read book for a 100 level course.
He's kinda neurotic but funny at the same time.  The material is pretty basic and the assignments aren't too tough - it's nice just as an elective even if you're not a crim student.
hes funny...plays music before lecture starts and during the break.  ORGANIZED!!!
Very animated and entertaining, overall nice guy...covers a lot of material, but the notes provided are sparse.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
tonnes of readings
What's up with his lecture voice?! He sounds like a sheep!
helpful, caring, expects a lot
